name: Mumbai
shortDescription: The city of dreams, bustling with energy, Bollywood glamour, and stunning coastal views.
description: Mumbai, the financial capital of India, is a vibrant metropolis that never sleeps. From the iconic Gateway of India to the bustling streets of Colaba, this city offers an incredible mix of colonial architecture, modern skyscrapers, and traditional markets.

topAttractions.name: Gateway of India
topAttractions.description: Iconic monument overlooking the Arabian Sea, built during British rule

topAttractions.name: Marine Drive
topAttractions.description: Scenic 3.6 km long boulevard along the coast, perfect for evening walks

topAttractions.name: Elephanta Caves
topAttractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site with ancient rock-cut cave temples

topAttractions.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus
topAttractions.description: Historic railway station, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

topAttractions.name: Haji Ali Dargah
topAttractions.description: Stunning mosque located on an islet off the coast of Worli

localFood: Vada Pav - Mumbai's iconic street food burger
Pav Bhaji - Spicy vegetable curry with buttered bread
Bhel Puri - Tangy and crunchy street snack
Bombay Duck Fry - Local fish specialty
Misal Pav - Spicy sprouts curry
travelTips: Local trains are the fastest way to travel, but can be extremely crowded during rush hours
Try street food at Juhu Beach and Mohammed Ali Road
Book Elephanta Caves ferry tickets in advance during peak season
Use Uber or Ola for convenient taxi services
Keep small change handy for local purchases

name: Delhi
shortDescription: India's capital city, a perfect blend of ancient heritage and modern development.
description: Delhi, the heart of India, is a city where history comes alive. From Mughal monuments to British-era buildings, bustling bazaars to modern metro, Delhi offers an unforgettable experience. The city is divided into Old Delhi with its narrow lanes and rich heritage, and New Delhi with wide roads and contemporary architecture.

topAttractions.name: Red Fort
topAttractions.description: Magnificent Mughal fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

topAttractions.name: India Gate
topAttractions.description: War memorial and iconic landmark of Delhi

topAttractions.name: Qutub Minar
topAttractions.description: World's tallest brick minaret, UNESCO World Heritage Site

topAttractions.name: Lotus Temple
topAttractions.description: Architectural marvel designed in the shape of a lotus flower

topAttractions.name: Humayun's Tomb
topAttractions.description: Beautiful Mughal garden tomb, inspiration for Taj Mahal

localFood: Chole Bhature - Spicy chickpeas with fried bread
Butter Chicken - Creamy tomato-based curry
Paranthe Wali Gali - Famous lane for stuffed parathas
Daulat Ki Chaat - Seasonal winter dessert
Kebabs at Karim's - Historic Mughlai restaurant
travelTips: Delhi Metro is the best way to avoid traffic
Visit monuments early morning to avoid crowds and heat
Try street food at Chandni Chowk, but choose busy stalls
Hire a guide for historical monuments to understand their significance
Be cautious of touts near tourist attractions

name: Bangalore
shortDescription: The Silicon Valley of India, known for its pleasant weather, parks, and vibrant culture.
description: Bangalore, officially known as Bengaluru, is India's IT hub and one of the most cosmopolitan cities. Known for its pleasant climate year-round, the city offers beautiful parks, historic palaces, modern shopping malls, and a thriving food scene. It's also the gateway to exploring Karnataka's rich heritage.

topAttractions.name: Lalbagh Botanical Garden
topAttractions.description: Historic 240-acre garden with rare plants and glass house

topAttractions.name: Bangalore Palace
topAttractions.description: Tudor-style palace inspired by Windsor Castle

topAttractions.name: Cubbon Park
topAttractions.description: Sprawling 300-acre green space in the heart of the city

topAttractions.name: ISKCON Temple
topAttractions.description: Beautiful temple dedicated to Lord Krishna

topAttractions.name: Vidhana Soudha
topAttractions.description: Impressive legislative building showcasing Dravidian architecture

localFood: Masala Dosa - Crispy rice crepe with spiced potato filling
Bisi Bele Bath - Spicy rice and lentil dish
Filter Coffee - Authentic South Indian coffee
Idli Vada - Steamed rice cakes with lentil fritters
Ragi Mudde - Nutritious finger millet balls
travelTips: Traffic can be heavy, plan extra travel time
Use metro and app-based cabs for easy commuting
Explore the cafe culture in Koramangala and Indiranagar
Visit nearby Nandi Hills for sunrise views (60 km away)
Try local breakfast at MTR or Vidyarthi Bhavan

name: Jaipur
shortDescription: The Pink City, famous for magnificent palaces, forts, and vibrant Rajasthani culture.
description: Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan, is famously known as the Pink City due to its distinctive pink-colored buildings. This royal city is home to magnificent forts, opulent palaces, and colorful bazaars. Jaipur forms part of the Golden Triangle tourist circuit and offers a glimpse into India's regal past.

topAttractions.name: Amber Fort
topAttractions.description: Majestic hilltop fort with elephant rides and stunning architecture

topAttractions.name: Hawa Mahal
topAttractions.description: Iconic five-story palace with 953 windows

topAttractions.name: City Palace
topAttractions.description: Royal residence with museums showcasing Rajput heritage

topAttractions.name: Jantar Mantar
topAttractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, astronomical observatory with giant instruments

topAttractions.name: Nahargarh Fort
topAttractions.description: Hill fort offering panoramic views of the Pink City

localFood: Dal Baati Churma - Traditional Rajasthani dish
Ghewar - Sweet dessert made during festivals
Laal Maas - Spicy mutton curry
Pyaaz Kachori - Fried pastry with onion filling
Lassi - Traditional yogurt drink
travelTips: Book palace hotels in advance for royal experience
Hire a guide to learn about fort histories
Shop at Johari Bazaar for jewelry and textiles
Try elephant rides at Amber Fort early morning
Attend cultural shows at Chokhi Dhani village resort

name: Goa
shortDescription: India's beach paradise with stunning coastline, Portuguese heritage, and vibrant nightlife.
description: Goa, India's smallest state, is famous for its pristine beaches, Portuguese colonial architecture, vibrant nightlife, and laid-back atmosphere. From the party beaches of North Goa to the serene shores of South Goa, this coastal paradise offers something for everyone. Rich in history and natural beauty, Goa is a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure.

topAttractions.name: Baga Beach
topAttractions.description: Popular beach known for water sports and nightlife

topAttractions.name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
topAttractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, 400-year-old church

topAttractions.name: Fort Aguada
topAttractions.description: 17th-century Portuguese fort with lighthouse

topAttractions.name: Dudhsagar Falls
topAttractions.description: Spectacular four-tiered waterfall amidst lush forests

topAttractions.name: Anjuna Flea Market
topAttractions.description: Colorful Wednesday market with handicrafts and clothes

localFood: Fish Curry Rice - Goan staple with coconut-based curry
Vindaloo - Spicy pork curry with Portuguese influence
Bebinca - Traditional layered dessert
Xacuti - Chicken or lamb in complex curry
Sorpotel - Spicy pork dish
travelTips: Rent a scooter to explore at your own pace
Try fresh seafood at beach shacks
Book accommodation in advance during peak season
Visit spice plantations for unique experience
Respect local culture when visiting religious sites

name: Kolkata
shortDescription: The City of Joy, rich in culture, literature, art, and colonial architecture.
description: Kolkata, formerly known as Calcutta, is the cultural capital of India. Known for its colonial architecture, art galleries, literary heritage, and intellectual atmosphere, Kolkata offers a unique blend of old-world charm and modern development. The city is famous for its festivals, especially Durga Puja, which transforms the entire city into a grand celebration.

topAttractions.name: Victoria Memorial
topAttractions.description: Iconic white marble monument with museum

topAttractions.name: Howrah Bridge
topAttractions.description: Iconic cantilever bridge over Hooghly River

topAttractions.name: Indian Museum
topAttractions.description: Oldest and largest museum in India

topAttractions.name: Dakshineswar Temple
topAttractions.description: Hindu temple complex on the banks of Hooghly

topAttractions.name: Park Street
topAttractions.description: Vibrant street known for restaurants and nightlife

localFood: Rosogolla - Iconic Bengali sweet
Kathi Roll - Wrapped street food with fillings
Hilsa Fish Curry - Bengali delicacy
Mishti Doi - Sweet yogurt dessert
Puchka - Bengali version of pani puri
travelTips: Use yellow taxis or metro for commuting
Visit during Durga Puja (September/October) for grand celebrations
Explore College Street for books and intellectual atmosphere
Try Bengali sweets at famous shops like KC Das
Take a ferry ride on Hooghly River
